questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common method of contraception?
What is the primary advantage of using condoms for contraception?
choices: They are the most effective method
They protect against both pregnancy and STIs
They are the easiest to obtain
questions.answer: They protect against both pregnancy and STIs

questions.question: Which of the following is a long-acting reversible contraceptive (LARC)?
What is the first step in proper condom use?
Why is it important to pinch the tip of the condom before rolling it on?
choices: To remove air and leave space for semen
To make it easier to roll down
questions.answer: To remove air and leave space for semen

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common sexually transmitted infection (STI)?
Why is regular STI testing important?
choices: It's only necessary for people with multiple partners

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a method of STI prevention?
What is one of the early signs of pregnancy?
Why is prenatal care important?
choices: It's only necessary for first-time mothers
It monitors the health of both mother and baby
questions.answer: It monitors the health of both mother and baby

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically part of prenatal care?
What is a common barrier to accessing sexual and reproductive health services in Timor-Leste?
What role does education play in promoting sexual and reproductive health?
choices: It's not important for sexual health
It provides knowledge for informed decision-making
It replaces the need for healthcare services
questions.answer: It provides knowledge for informed decision-making

questions.question: Which of the following is a key component of comprehensive sex education?
What is the purpose of an anonymous question box in sex education?
choices: To allow students to ask sensitive questions privately
questions.answer: To allow students to ask sensitive questions privately

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically discussed in a lesson on puberty?
What is consent in the context of sexual relationships?
choices: Voluntary agreement to engage in sexual activity
Something that's only necessary the first time
questions.answer: Voluntary agreement to engage in sexual activity

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of a healthy relationship?
choices: One partner making all the decisions

questions.question: What is the purpose of a relationship 'bill of rights'?
choices: To outline expectations and boundaries in a relationship
To list reasons for breaking up
questions.answer: To outline expectations and boundaries in a relationship

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a form of contraception?
What is the primary function of prenatal vitamins?
choices: To support the mother's and baby's nutritional needs
questions.answer: To support the mother's and baby's nutritional needs

questions.question: Which of the following is a sign that labor may be beginning?
What is the recommended frequency of prenatal check-ups in a typical pregnancy?
choices: Monthly, then more frequently in later stages
questions.answer: Monthly, then more frequently in later stages

questions.question: Which STI is known as 'the silent infection' because it often has no symptoms?
What is PrEP in the context of HIV prevention?
choices: A medication taken to reduce the risk of HIV infection
questions.answer: A medication taken to reduce the risk of HIV infection

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical stage of puberty?
What is the purpose of a pap smear?
Which of the following is NOT a method of natural family planning?
What is emergency contraception?
choices: A regular form of birth control
A backup method to prevent pregnancy after unprotected sex
questions.answer: A backup method to prevent pregnancy after unprotected sex

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common side effect of hormonal birth control?
